meanings.sent1: The tiny bird can outfly the big eagle.
meanings.sent2: The jet plane can outfly the propeller plane easily.
meanings.sent3: The butterfly challenged the dragonfly to outfly it in a race.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams could outfly any obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape billowed behind him as he seemed to outfly the wind itself.

meanings.definition: To fly faster or farther than.
meanings.sent1: The new drone design can outfly all previous models.
meanings.sent2: The migratory birds outfly the storm to reach warmer lands.
meanings.sent3: The paper airplane managed to outfly the toy helicopter.
meanings.sent4: Her determination allowed her to outfly her fears and doubts.
meanings.sent5: The champion racehorse seemed to effortlessly outfly its competitors on the track.

meanings.sent1: The superhero's ability to outfly any aircraft amazed the onlookers.
meanings.sent2: The dragon could outfly any other mythical creature in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The kite outfly the other kites in the sky competition.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination could outfly any boundaries set by reality.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon seemed to outfly the clouds, reaching for the stars above.
